description:
Powerful, durable and weather-resistant, the BC Link 2.0 takes a great backcountry communication tool and makes it even better. Whether you're looking for the best possible ski line or trying to keep your ski group together in touchy terrain, having 2-way communication makes your day easier and more fun. With a battery that lasts for days, you can go on hut trips without waking up to a dead device. The microphone grill is faceplant-ready and won't pack up with snow, helping keep communication clear.

  • Base unit stows inside your pack or clips to your belt to keep it warm and protected, while the mic clips to your shoulder strap for easy access
  • Mic has glove-friendly controls including push-to-talk, volume and channel selection so you can communicate without fumbling in your pack
  • Smart Mic grill is designed to avoid snowpacking
  • 2 Watts of power ensures clear communication and increased useable range
  • Battery power percentage display takes the guesswork out of evaluating battery level
  • Integrated 2300mAh lithium ion battery lasts about 80 hours of normal use, 400 hours in standby mode
  • Uses standard FRS and GMRS channels for compatibility with other standard radios
  • 22 channels and 121 sub-channels allow your group to find a free one
  • Useable range of 9.5km line of sight. Maximum range of 64km line of sight
  • Updated cable connection to the base unit is solid and durable
  • Waterproof to IP56 standard
  • Radios sold individually
  • Only approved for use in North America
name: Backcountry Access BC Link 2.0
